reviews.text: This place costs as much as an average hostel, but meets the standards of at least a 1- or 2-star hotel!
reviews.title: Hotel Quality with Hostel Prices, Geared toward Anglos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is perfect, near railway, metro and tram stations. They give you a free map of the city and provide city tours, with a tour guide or self-guided (all available in English).
reviews.title: What an awesome place and great value for money.

reviews.text: This place is definitely geared towards international travellers, particularly English-speakers. All the staff speak perfect English and there are helpful signs on the computers to figure out the German keyboards.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic. No beating Wombats!!

reviews.text: Bed sheets are included, but towels cost extra.
reviews.title: Very, very good!

reviews.text: They have an area filled with armchairs and hammocks, perfect for hanging out or napping.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Wombat's!

reviews.text: Can't think of one bad thing to say about this hostel. Really friendly staff and always very quick to answer one's needs. Very, very clean. Very, very convenient - right next to the main train station which also is a central hub for the metro, bus and tram systems. Each room has an ensuite bathroom so one doesn't have to trek down the hall. Bright, happy colors. Excellent security, with one credit card size key that opens all doors and also locks up the in-room locker. Wonderful all-you-can eat breakfast for 3.70 euros with fresh rolls, cheese, salami, ham, cereal, tomatoes, cucumbers, fresh fruit, yogurt, bread for toast, jam, butter, waffle mix, orange juice, tea and the most wonderful coffee machine that dispenses about ten different kinds of drinks, including wonderful cappuccino and hot chocolate. (I fell in love with this machine!) Free fresh towels on request.
reviews.title: One of hte Best Hostels

reviews.text: Oops, thought of one negative - the interenet is available only in the lobby area and on occasion it was really, really sloooow.
reviews.title: Fabulous hostel experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend.
reviews.title: close to the train station and a good atmosphere for college students

reviews.text: I couldn't imagine a better hostel experience. The reception desk was very friendly and helpful. We got off of a night train and were dying for a shower, and they let us shower right away. The location is super convenient from the train station and a very pretty 5 minute walk from the city center. The rooms were very nice and had spacious lockers. Free towels, too!
reviews.title: A great place to make new friends!

reviews.text: I was nervous as to who we would be roomed with. Turns out that we hung out with them our entire trip! Clearly, wombat's considers who they put in rooms together, becasue odds are we wouldn't have gotten such great roommates. I have never stayed in a hostel before, but they explained that this is the best you can find hostel-wise.
reviews.title: not the cheapest but with excellent location

reviews.text: Our 6 bed female dorm only had 2 powerpoints which was not enough. The rooms often face the street which is very noisy.
reviews.title: Good but noisy and needs more powerpoints

reviews.text: The breakfast is good (It costs extra) and the rooms are very clean.
reviews.title: Fun, clean, safe hostel in an excellent location!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights in April 2010. I was very pleased with this hostel. It was more like staying in an IKEA store! My friend and I stayed in a female dorm with 4 or so other women, and it was very clean and comfortable. This was my first time staying in a "dorm" room with other people at a hostel, and I have to say, it was an amazing experience! The room had 4 bunk beds, and lockers for your things. Your room card (key) was also the key to the lockers so you only had to keep up with one item which was brilliant! The bar was a very lively spot to talk with and meet other travellers. Loved the free drink ticket you received upon check in. We could walk into town and to food easily from our location. Will definitely be visiting other Wombats in the future! Highly recommend.
reviews.title: clean, happening, all around good value

reviews.text: The Wombats chain is famous for its youth-focused bar and threadbare but sufficient rooms. Munich's Wombats is very much of the same ilk. You can't go wrong! Be sure to bring your own towel and be prepared for the party focus of the Wombat clientele. You get a free drink voucher when you check in so you can join in the fun too! A true backpacker's hostel.
reviews.title: get a private room if you're not a frat boy

reviews.text: i just spent 2 nights in a 6 bed mixed dorm and probably got half the sleep i should have thanks to all the late night door slamming puking(both nights) and finally, sex. while the place is clean and has some good features the en suite bathrooms are probably a bad idea unless you like a symphony of retching at 4 am, both nights in my case. don't stay here if you have something to do the next day.
reviews.title: Go if you want to meet pepole-not if you're on a budget.

reviews.text: I did a solo trip to Munich and had a great time. I stayed here and a hotel at the end of my stay, and met alot of people here! Take the morning walking tour, perfect way to meet some people, esp if you are solo. Go to the bar, buy a drink and start talking. 5 min or less walk to the train station, 10-15 to the part of town everyone walks to. Recommended for anyone on a budget or trying to socialize. Bring earplugs for the snoring people in the room and a towel so you dont have to rent one. Wi-Fi was ONLY accessible from the common area below.
reviews.title: Great for making friends and socializing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and friendly.. The tour with Ozzie around the city was great.
reviews.title: Great hostel for young people!
Excellent hostel
reviews.text: We stayed in a 6 person dorm and were so unfortunate with having the loudest 50 year old snorer the duration of our stay I have EVER heard. The bathroom was also fairly disgusting, but what do you expect when you stay with 2 50 year old extremely hairy men. Guess my partner and I got unlucky - and no more dorms on the cheapo for us anymore.
The common area was good and the computers were good too, approx 1 euro for 40 mins. The bar was cool, nice staff and cheap drinks. The place had a fun vibe... Def for young people.
reviews.title: Just great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit on the expensive side compared to other hostels, but it's worth the price. Perfect location, very clean, good breakfast and happy hour (cheap beer!). Staff is great. I got some great recommendations from them.
reviews.title: Best hostel ever
